intro: Walafrida pubescens, commonly known as the hairy walafrida, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which provide protection against herbivores and excessive moisture loss. Its flowers are typically yellow to orange in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Walafrida pubescens is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
